comments:
Steps to reproduce:
1.New a data source and two data sets
2.New a cascading parameter group, add one parameter with one data set
3.Change data set mode to Multiple data set
4.Add another parameter with another data set 
5.Preview

Expected result:
Two parameters value is listed on the drop-down list

Actual result:
The first parameter value is not retrieved, the value list is empty.
If label is null, set label using value.

Created an attachment (id=43846)
Throw DataException

Can't retrieve the first parameter. Throw the follow exception.

org.eclipse.birt.data.engine.core.DataException: Group key "PAYMENTDATE" in group 2 cannot depend on column bindings defined in the group lower than itself. 
	at org.eclipse.birt.data.engine.impl.ExprManagerUtil.checkGroupNameValidation(ExprManagerUtil.java:79)
	at org.eclipse.birt.data.engine.impl.ExprManagerUtil.validateColumnBinding(ExprManagerUtil.java:57)
	at org.eclipse.birt.data.engine.impl.ExprManager.validateColumnBinding(ExprManager.java:171)
	at org.eclipse.birt.data.engine.impl.ServiceForQueryResults.validateQueryColumBinding(ServiceForQueryResults.java:315)
	at org.eclipse.birt.data.engine.impl.QueryResults.getResultIterator(QueryResults.java:157)
	at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.api.impl.GetParameterDefinitionTask.evaluateQuery(GetParameterDefinitionTask.java:608)
	at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.api.impl.GetParameterDefinitionTask.getChoicesFromParameterGroup(GetParameterDefinitionTask.java:682)
	at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.api.impl.GetParameterDefinitionTask.getSelectionList(GetParameterDefinitionTask.java:336)
	at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.api.impl.GetParameterDefinitionTask.getSelectionListForCascadingGroup(GetParameterDefinitionTask.java:670)

Created an attachment (id=44066)
Compare with correct cascading parameter group

I attached a picture which is a comparison result between the cascading group defination of this design file and a correct cascading group defination. The left one is the defination in this design file, the right one is the correct defination.

The error in this design is that:
1. The cascading parameter group is changed to "Multiple" model, but it still has a dataset.
2. The first parameter doesn't have a dataset.
Using the data set handle on the scalar parameter if the cascading parameter type is muliptle data set type.

traces.message: Group key "PAYMENTDATE" in group 2 cannot depend on column bindings defined in the group lower than itself.
